intro: Hieracium sabaudum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
